title: Spell Slots
excerpt: A limited resource that represents the magical energy you can expend to cast spells. Spell slots are expended when you cast a spell and are regained when you finish a long rest.
markdown:
# Spell Slots

Regardless of how many spells a caster knows or prepares, they can cast only a limited number of spells before resting. Manipulating the fabric of magic and channeling its energy into even a simple spell is physically and mentally taxing, and higher-level spells are even more so.

## Spell Slot Levels

Spell slots are divided into levels from 1st to 9th:
- **1st-level slots**: Cast 1st-level spells
- **2nd-level slots**: Cast 2nd-level spells
- And so on up to 9th level

## Using Spell Slots

When you cast a spell, you expend a spell slot of the spell's level or higher. For example:
- To cast the 1st-level spell *Magic Missile*, you must expend a 1st-level slot
- If you want to cast it using a 2nd-level slot, you canâ€”the spell is cast at a higher level

## Casting at Higher Levels

Some spells have enhanced effects when cast using a higher-level spell slot. For example:
- *Magic Missile* creates one additional dart for each slot level above 1st
- *Cure Wounds* heals more hit points when cast at higher levels

The spell's description tells you what happens when you cast it at a higher level.

## Regaining Spell Slots

You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a [[long_rest]].

### Exceptions
- **Warlocks**: Regain spell slots on a [[short_rest]]
- **Arcane Recovery** (Wizard): Recover some spell slots during a short rest
- **Sorcery Points** (Sorcerer): Can convert sorcery points to spell slots

## Cantrips Don't Use Slots

[[cantrip|Cantrips]] are 0-level spells that don't require spell slots and can be cast at will.
